snippet: The pace of executions has quickened, with 21 prisoners put to death this week, but the authorities postponed the hanging of one convicted when he was 14.
abstract: Pakistan hangs nine prisoners, raising number of those executed since Prime Min Nawaz Sharif lifted moratorium on death penalty in December to 48; rate of executions in Pakistan has been accelerating, drawing protests from rights groups.
lead_paragraph: The pace of executions has quickened, with 21 prisoners put to death this week, but the authorities postponed the hanging of one convicted when he was 14.

headline.main: Pakistan Steps Up Executions of Convicts, but One Gets Reprieve
